review Obviously one must hold regard for Grace Kelly to read this book. Since one of my life questions to myself when a social, character building decision n Obviously one must hold regard for Grace Kelly to read this book. Since one of my life questions to myself when a social, character building decision needs to be made Is..."What would Grace Kelly do?" Readers will enjoy this book because it does not dwell on her flawless delicate looks. You learn she wore glasses, paid for her own education even though she was a blue blood in real life. Grace always worked, followed social decorum with a flair of being a rebel, and was not able to win her own fathers approval on anything through her entire life. I admired Grace for not getting mental about the fact her father slighted her. He would not acknowledge his daughter did indeed pocess greatness loaded with talent. Grace's love life is intresting. The fact she married a Prince and how she married a Prince is worth the read. I also read this book because I wanted to be clued into her death that was so tragic. I learned why the car accident happened and the degree of love she actually had for her husband. Grace Kelly is a private person so if you want to know her as a person you need to sit with this book. I enjoyed and felt a better connection to the Great Grace Kelly. ...more

review by chapter 3 I knew Who I suspected 'did it'. What made this book enjoyable reading is that it delivered, mystery,suspense, court room trial, unique b by chapter 3 I knew Who I suspected 'did it'. What made this book enjoyable reading is that it delivered, mystery,suspense, court room trial, unique but highly believable characters, Mothers POV Dad POV, and as the title implys an excellent Child's POV, a slime ball Husband POV, and a Grandmothers POV. While it may seem like too many POV's as the reader you don't actually realize all these POV's are there...till you have finished the book and then you realize the gift Richard North Patterson has for weaving all this in. The story line flows beautifully and if you enjoy Justice trial scenes you are hooked. I was correct in who I suspected "did it" but the author is very successful in throwing you off gently during the course of the book. The court room stragety, and conversations are especially clever, and intresting. Richard North Patterson has the right background and connections to write these best sellers. I think this book was written 15 years ago and still stands the test of time. ...more

review OK a lot of this rang true.. things you do without realizing to be imaginative when all you thought you were doing was getting away or just doing some OK a lot of this rang true.. things you do without realizing to be imaginative when all you thought you were doing was getting away or just doing something you enjoyed,,, now the bathroom conversations being centralized did not surprise me. look if major profit making companies design their culture to have this why should I question it think about it. Brain storming sessions don't work unless they are arranged properly? but the problem is you can't design a brain storming session that works. This is true in mm opinion.. You can design trips that inspire new thinking but throwing people in a room won't work. This i agree with. I do consider myself to be on the imaginative side so this book would only enforce what I suspected. I only gave it three stars for this reason. If you are not an imaginative person Run to get this book you may give it 5 stars and uncover a whole new you. ...more

review Having adored laura Hillenbrad's first book "seabiscuit" I read "unbroked" 398 pages of grafic torture, her World war II Story of Survial. I am not ad Having adored laura Hillenbrad's first book "seabiscuit" I read "unbroked" 398 pages of grafic torture, her World war II Story of Survial. I am not admittly one who reads any world war II books because I just don't enjoy them. My book club is reading this for January... which put heavy weight on me to actually read, so I could particiate. This is an extremly intense book and brought undescriable pain that haunted me during the read. I am now glad to know and know of Louis Zamperini an incrediable man who survived being a POW during world war II. If you enjoy war stories this is a must read. If you like me have to make yourself read war stories then if you will be taken to another level of feelings you have never experienced. Honestly I wanted more redemption but understand why this is not possible for the "truth" of the book to be experienced. This book will always haunt me. ...more

review This novel is jam packed with interesting perspectives, unforgettable characters, religion history, education on burn victims, not to mention mouth wa This novel is jam packed with interesting perspectives, unforgettable characters, religion history, education on burn victims, not to mention mouth watering food suggestions. Admittedly the best part of the book was the first 3/4. For me the ending was OK but not up to the emotional place it truly take you. Several reviewers said they found Maryann a little cold and unfeeling. Those reviews came from men. As a woman/lady I found Maryann loaded with compassion, her past fascinating and how she tied into the main character writing the book (we never get his name)compelling. The book is titled well and as for the author getting a huge advance because everything was over the top (oh Yes everything)I can see why he commanded big bucks. This book takes you through, fire, hell,hospitals,drug addiction, vivid paranormal experiences that literally have you feeling you can reach out and touch what is happening. The depth, history, loyalty to beliefs is worth the read. I am not going to say this was an easy read, or a difficult read lets just say I had quite the adventure the author intends for us to have. This book is beyond a reading experience ... visually we are allowed to be taken back in time, feel the bravery,the heat, the love, the education and jump in. I will not forget this book. ...more

review This book touches your memory. Your memories shape who you are. Me personally I enjoyed the main character in MOST ways portrayed. She makes lots of d This book touches your memory. Your memories shape who you are. Me personally I enjoyed the main character in MOST ways portrayed. She makes lots of different choices. By that I mean you can walk in her shoes and feel the choices she makes. The core of this book is reveled in the end. Frankly I was dissapointed in the ending. Way too tragic for the hopefulness you were strung out to believe. The ending is wacked out in my opinion and could have been done as well as the first 3/4 of the book. Even for Anne Rivers Siddons the ending was crazy. Ive read and enjoyed other books by this author, which is why I wanted to read this. This authors writing is exceptional portrayal of southern upbringing and beautiful strong women. Usually has more life like endings but I knocked a star off for the ending of this read....other wise it would have gotten 4 solid stars. ...more

review Interesting,,, Andrew Young was truthful during the book and did not try to put himself in a "golden" light. John Edwards flaw was knowing he had wronged his family, the country, and his campaign and he thought he was bullet proof. Of all the character in the book MS Hunter has to be the on no one will ever feel sympathy. she's exactly what she appears to be .. a husband stealer. ...more

review People can change if the right person comes into their life. I was prepared to have little sympathy for Patrick whose character does change over a per People can change if the right person comes into their life. I was prepared to have little sympathy for Patrick whose character does change over a period of time. Patrick's Doctor was bold and interesting. The dog was a necessary touch but could have gone with out the gross habit of the dog. Be prepared for strange always with the author Irving. There was a lot of business that could have been stepped up. John Irving lives up to his talent of having a regular story come to life through luminous descriptions,unique nuisances. Regular women become beautiful, and pretty women become overbearing. To me this was not the usual quality of Irving but the humor stands out in the way life can give you day to day surprises and life changing surprises. ...more

review What I learned from this book. I am one of those people that likes to make decisions. The reader is given a chance to make actual decisions that were What I learned from this book. I am one of those people that likes to make decisions. The reader is given a chance to make actual decisions that were made in history. Some by Nixon, Kennedy, and Lincoln. You see how you would have done in these situations. This is not one of those measuring sticks that tells you there is no wrong decision. There is always a best decision. James Stein explains elements of decisions. Many times math is involved other times a decision making approach is used. If you read Blink or tipping point you might as well add this one to the mix. James Stein does a good job without not talking over anyone's head or dragging something out. Anyone can better their decision process after reading this. ...more

review I will read this author again. Can't really recommend this particular book to start a Dalgliesh series. Way too many Characters so there is no chance I will read this author again. Can't really recommend this particular book to start a Dalgliesh series. Way too many Characters so there is no chance in getting attached to one character. The description from the author has you feeling you are right in England, shady days and all. I don't think the sun came out once in this book. Her descriptions are 5 star but I must admit I was drawing stick people in a little note book to keep up with all the suspects and characters. I thought the ending was whacked out. Great for all those that could take 560 pages to get to this ending. One of the other reviewers reccommend starting with "the murder room". I will try PD James again I am giving it 3 stars for the complete success the author has in taking you to England. My review before I trudged through 560 pages.... I must have missed the boat not to have learned about this author before. The view of England, all the etiquette, polished manners people put forth and of course a dead body with a note. I am really enjoying this I just stumbled upon it at the library it was a staff person recommend. ...more

review These girls kept their friendships and lives going over classic novels. to see friends pushed away, kept in the dark, share food, keep secrets, and lov These girls kept their friendships and lives going over classic novels. to see friends pushed away, kept in the dark, share food, keep secrets, and love one another for who they authentically are.
